other_tests.findings: Markedly increased aldosterone levels on the left, confirming the diagnosis of aldosterone-producing adenoma.

other_tests.procedure_name: Laparoscopic resection of the left adrenal gland
other_tests.findings: Hypertension resolved immediately after surgery, allowing discontinuation of antihypertensive medications.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient reported improvement of her symptoms and remained normotensive and asymptomatic 7 years after surgery.

other_tests.findings: Aldosterone was 79 ng/dL, more than twice the normal level.
